sources.title: Lucky Ghost
sources.description: Mantan Moreland and F. E. Miller are down at the heels, that is until a craps shoot wins Mantan a gambling casino. Too bad it's haunted by a family of prudish ghosts. The sequel to "Mr. Washington Goes to Town," which sadly appears to be a lost film. Directed by William Beaudine (as William X Crowley) Released in 1942. a.k.a. "Lady Luck" Tape-transferred complete print. MANTAN MORELAND MOVIES HERE AT IA: https://archive.org/post/1006776/the-mantan-moreland-list-update

sources.title: Lucky Ghost (1942) MANTAN MORELAND
sources.description:
SEQUEL TO "MR. WASHINGTON GOES TO TOWN"
Stars: Mantan Moreland, F.E. Miller, Maceo Bruce Sheffield
Director: William Beaudine

Two down-on-their-luck friends suddenly hit the "jackpot" when they win the clothes, car, and chauffeur of a rich man in a game of dice. They wind up in a sanitarium that's being used as an exclusive, though illegal, gambling club and get mixed up with beautiful women, jealous gangsters, and ghosts.
